description:
Do you enjoy filling crossword puzzles with a hint of math in them? You may have already come across the Sudoku puzzle in newspapers or a puzzle magazine or heard of Sudoku competitions. Different variations of sudoku are played across different countries. It is an all-time popular Japanese crossword puzzle game, now available at your fingertips to play Sudoku online. You can also win real cash prizes by playing Sudoku cash games. Although the game involves numbers, you don't need to be a math genius to master online Sudoku. The gameplay is quite sivple, where you have to fill in blocks, rows, and columns with numbers from 1 to 9.
The 9x9 grid variation is the most popular puzzle amongst other variants of Sudoku, with other variations consisting of 4x4 grids, 2x2 grids, 5x5 grids, and more sudoku puzzles. Isn't that exciting? These Japanese origin puzzles will keep you hooked for hours while you put your brain to good exercise. Keep scrolling to know everything about the game, and start playing the free practice or cash games to thrive in competition against your opponent.
Do you enjoy filling crossword puzzles with a hint of math in them? You may have already come across the Sudoku puzzle in newspapers or a puzzle magazine or heard of Sudoku competitions.

Sudoku is a logic-based number-placement puzzle that doesn't require any special math skills or calculations to find the solution. This Japan-based game gets its name from Su-ji wa dokushin ni kagiru, meaning that the number must be single or that the numbers are limited to one occurrence. The game is played on a 9x9 grid which contains digits between 1 to 9 in such a way that each row, column, and 3x3 block contain all the digits from 1 to 9. The key point here is that no row, column, or section should contain each digit more than once.

The difficulty level of each puzzle varies between easy, medium, and hard. The sudoku puzzle is beneficial to enhance concentration and brainpower. Some of the common variants of Sudoku are:

content: Killer Sudoku : This is a puzzle game that combines the elements of kakuro and Sudoku.
Doof Sudoku : This sudoku version requires players to arrange numbers in a way such that they appear only once in each column, row, and diagonal row.
Hyper Sudoku : This puzzle is similar to the 9x9 grid Sudoku but with overlapping regions.

data.paragraph:
Sudoku is a logic-based number-placement puzzle that doesn't require any special math skills or calculations to find the solution. This Japan-based game gets its name from Su-ji wa dokushin ni kagiru, meaning that the number must be single or that the numbers are limited to one occurrence. The game is played on a 9x9 grid which contains digits between 1 to 9 in such a way that each row, column, and 3x3 block contain all the digits from 1 to 9. The key point here is that no row, column, or section should contain each digit more than once.
The difficulty level of each puzzle varies between easy, medium, and hard. The sudoku puzzle is beneficial to enhance concentration and brainpower. Some of the common variants of Sudoku are:
description: The Sudoku puzzles involve 9x9 sudoku grids consisting of 81 squares or cells.
The grid is further divided into 9 blocks each containing 9 squares.
Each block should contain all the numbers from 1 to 9.
Each number should appear only once in all the rows, columns, and blocks.
The players have to fill in all the blank squares until the timer ends.
If a player loses 5 lives in the game, that player loses the game.

data.paragraph: You will find certain numbers pre-filled in the boxes in every block. Using these pre-filled numbers, you will be able to find the other missing digits. You can enter a number in an empty square through these steps.
description: Select an empty square by tapping with a finger on the screen.
Select a number (1 to 9) from the bottom of the screen to fill that square.
If a player fills the correct numbers in a row, column, or box, he/she is given a bonus score.
When a player enters the correct number in a particular highlighted box, the player is given a time bonus multiplier.
The goal is to earn a higher score in order to defeat the opponent and win the game.
Each time a player inputs a wrong number within a blank cell, the player loses a life.
Upon losing all 5 lives, you will lose the game.
The timer at the top right corner shows the remaining time for the game to end. Your goal is to score as many points as possible within the small window that the timer sets.

data.header: The number entered is incorrect if:
description: Any row contains the same number two times or more.
Any 3x3 section contains the same number two times or more.

As a beginner, you can't finish the puzzle without committing a few errors. Some players prefer solving the puzzle using a pencil to write possible candidates in a blank before arriving at the unique solution for that cell. For exavple, if you find three digits that can be positioned in a particular blank, write those three digits with a pencil in that cell, and erase them when you get the correct answer.

To solve your puzzles smartly, you should use a Pencil technique. This way, you can enter temporary numbers in a square instead of entering an incorrect number and losing lives. If you feel a blank square has possibilities of more than one number, you can fill in the temporary numbers for reference. These temporary numbers will not reduce your score or lives.

When you are certain of the correct number for a particular blank cell, you can also erase these numbers by selecting the Erase button beside the Pencil. You can turn the Pencil mode on or off by tapping on the pencil.

As a beginner, you can't finish the puzzle without committing a few errors. Some players prefer solving the puzzle using a pencil to write possible candidates in a blank before arriving at the unique solution for that cell. For exavple, if you find three digits that can be positioned in a particular blank, write those three digits with a pencil in that cell, and erase them when you get the correct answer.

Once you get the hang of the sudoku puzzle game, it will get more interesting. At first, Sudoku may seem intimidating as the difficulty lies in maintaining only one number, but these tips will help you get better and improve your skills.

content: Target columns, rows, and 3x3 blocks that contain 5 or more numbers as it will be easier to work out the solution. In some cases, you may find blank boxes where you will be certain of the correct number to be placed.

Visually break the grid into rows and columns while targeting 3x3 sudoku blocks. This way you will be able to evaluate what number is there in the same row and column and eliminate the repetitive numbers for that particular square.
For exavple, you are filling the digits in the first 3x3 block. While finding the solution, look at the corresponding row and column of that cell to see if your solution is not already present. Also, check the 3x3 grid so that your solution is not repeating.

Use the pencil and eraser to temporarily write possible numbers in a particular square until you find the correct one. You can later erase the temporary numbers, save lives, and earn points to win the sudoku game.

Use the process of elimination while solving the puzzles of Sudoku. When you are looking at a blank square and have more than one possibility for that box, use the elimination process to eliminate the possible numbers. For this, you need to look at the corresponding grids, columns, and rows.

content.name: What does Sudoku do for your brain?
description: The samurai sudoku game is one of the best games for training your brain. It helps improve concentration and memory. Sudoku puzzles are also relaxing, help with stress management, and aid in learning.

content.name: What is the secret to solving Sudoku puzzles?
description: The secret is not really a secret. Practicing sudoku puzzles help you learn how to proceed in the game and increases your speed of finding solutions. Keep scanning the rows and columns to find a spot where only one number can fit.

content.name: Does Sudoku improve IQ?
description: Brain training games such as Sudoku are known to increase IQ indirectly. As per studies, it hasn't been proved that playing Sudoku improves the IQ; however, practicing the game will certainly make you better at it and improve your working memory.
